<line: 20> JOEL SILVA-DIAZ

[TITLE]
<line: 22> THE DEFENDANT:

[TEXT]
<line: 24> ☒    pleaded guilty to count(s) Information.
<line: 25> ☐    pleaded nolo contendere to count(s)  which was accepted by the court.
<line: 26> ☐    was found guilty on count(s)  after a plea of not guilty.

[TEXT]
<line: 28> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:

[TITLE]
<line: 30> Title and Section
<line: 31> Nature of Offense

[TEXT]
<line: 33> Offense Ended
<line: 34> Count

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1326(a) and 
<line: 37> (b)
<line: 38> Reentry of a Removed Alien

[TEXT]
<line: 40> 11/19/2016

[TEXT]
<line: 42> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through 3 of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to the Sentencing 
<line: 43> Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 45> ☐  The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s) .
<line: 46> ☐  Count(s)   dismissed on the motion of the United States.

[TEXT]
<line: 48> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence, 
<line: 49> or mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If ordered to pay 
<line: 50> restitution, the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances.

[TITLE]
<line: 52> 1/17/2017

[TEXT]
<line: 54> Date of Imposition of Judgment

[TITLE]
<line: 56> /s/ Dan A. Polster

[TITLE]
<line: 58> Honorable Dan A. Polster
<line: 59> United States District Judge

[TEXT]
<line: 61> Name and Title of Judge

[TEXT]
<line: 63> 1/19/2017
<line: 64> Date

<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev 11/16)  Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 5> Sheet 2 - Imprisonment

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Judgment - Page 2 of 3

[TITLE]
<line: 9> DEFENDANT: JOEL SILVA-DIAZ
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER: 2:16CR04627-001DP

[TITLE]
<line: 12> IMPRISONMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 14> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of: 60  days 
<line: 15> or time served, whichever is less.

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The Court recommends that Immigration and Customs Enforcement begin immediate removal proceedings.
<line: 18> Pursuant to section 5D1.1(c), the Court will not impose a term of supervised release.

[TEXT]
<line: 20> ☐ The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons:

[TEXT]
<line: 22> ☒    The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal.
<line: 23> ☐    The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district:
<line: 24>         ☐    at  on .
<line: 25>         ☐    as notified by the United States Marshal.
<line: 26> ☐    The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:
<line: 27>         ☐    before 2 p.m. on .
<line: 28>         ☐    as notified by the United States Marshal.
<line: 29>         ☐    as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office.

[TITLE]
<line: 31> RETURN

[TEXT]
<line: 33> I have executed this judgment as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 35> Defendant delivered on 
<line: 36> to
<line: 37> at
<line: 38> with a certified copy of this judgment.

[ABANDON]
<line: 40> UNITED STATES MARSHAL
<line: 41> By 
<line: 42> DEPUTY UNITED STATES MARSHAL

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev 11/16)  Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 5>   Sheet 6 – Criminal Monetary Penalties

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Judgment - Page 3 of 3

[TITLE]
<line: 9> DEFENDANT: JOEL SILVA-DIAZ
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER: 2:16CR04627-001DP

[TITLE]
<line: 12> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 14> The defendant must pay the following total criminal monetary penalties under the schedule of payments.
<line: 15> ☒     The Court hereby remits the defendant's Special Penalty Assessment; the fee is waived and no payment is required.

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Assessment
<line: 18> JVTA Assessment*
<line: 19> Fine
<line: 20> Restitution
<line: 21> $100.00 (Waived)
<line: 22> $
<line: 23> $
<line: 24> $

[TEXT]
<line: 26> * Justice for Victims of Trafficking Act of 2015, Pub. L. No. 114-22

[TITLE]
<line: 28> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 30> Payments shall be applied in the following order:  (1) assessment,  (2) restitution principal,  (3) restitution interest,  (4) fine principal,
<line: 31> (5) fine interest,  (6) community restitution,  (7) JVTA assessment,  (8) penalties; and  (9) costs, including cost of prosecution and 
<line: 32> court costs.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total fine and other criminal monetary penalties is due as follows:
<line: 35> The defendant will receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed.

[TEXT]
<line: 37> A     ☐     In full immediately; or
<line: 38> B     ☐     $ due immediately, balance due (see special instructions regarding payment of criminal monetary penalties).

[TEXT]
<line: 40> Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties: Criminal monetary penalties are to be made 
<line: 41> payable by cashier's check, bank or postal money order to the U.S. District Court Clerk, 333 Lomas Blvd. NW, Albuquerque, 
<line: 42> New Mexico 87102 unless otherwise noted by the court. Payments must include defendant's name, current address, case 
<line: 43> number and type of payment.

[TEXT]
<line: 45> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise in the special instruction above, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of 
<line: 46> criminal monetary penalties is due during the period of imprisonment. All criminal monetary penalties, except those payments made 
<line: 47> through the United States Bureau of Prisons' Inmate Financial Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of court.
